content.value_statement: Developers waste time searching Tailwind utility class documentation. This skill provides instant access to responsive breakpoints, component patterns, and configuration examples directly in your workflow.
actual_capabilities: Provides responsive breakpoint references for all Tailwind screen sizes
Shows common layout patterns including containers, flexbox, grid, and stacked layouts
Documents state modifiers for hover, focus, active, disabled, and group interactions
Delivers ready-to-use component examples for cards, buttons, forms, navbars, and alerts
Includes dark mode implementation patterns with class strategy
Explains spacing scale and arbitrary value syntax
limitations: Does not generate custom Tailwind configurations
Does not install or configure Tailwind in projects
Does not validate existing Tailwind implementations
Limited to Tailwind CSS v3 and later syntax

output_examples.input: Create a form input with focus states
output_examples.output:
Accessible form input with focus ring:

```html
<input type="text"
  class="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg
         focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent
         focus:outline-none"
  placeholder="Enter text">
```

Focus states:
- focus:ring-2 (blue ring on focus)
- focus:border-transparent (remove default border)
- focus:outline-none (remove browser outline)

best_practices: Use mobile-first approach by applying base classes for small screens, then add responsive prefixes for larger viewports.
Leverage utility composition rather than custom CSS classes. Combine existing utilities for most styling needs.
Apply focus-visible instead of focus for interactive elements that should show focus only during keyboard navigation.
anti_patterns: Avoid arbitrary values like w-[123px] when existing scale values can achieve the same result with consistency.
Do not use fixed widths exclusively. Prefer flexible layouts with max-w- constraints for better responsiveness.
Avoid excessive nesting of div elements just to apply spacing. Use gap on parent containers instead of margin on children.

faq.question: What versions of Tailwind does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Tailwind CSS v3 and later patterns and syntax. Some features like arbitrary values and dark mode with class strategy require v3.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with React, Vue, or plain HTML?
faq.answer: Yes. Tailwind utility classes are framework-agnostic. The patterns work identically in React components, Vue templates, or static HTML.

faq.question: Does this skill install Tailwind in my project?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides reference patterns and code examples only. Use the official Tailwind CLI or framework integration guides for installation.

faq.question: How do I customize colors beyond the default palette?
faq.answer: Extend the theme in tailwind.config.js with custom colors. The skill provides component patterns using default palette colors as examples.

faq.question: Are these patterns accessible?
faq.answer: The patterns include focus states for keyboard navigation and use semantic HTML. Always test with screen readers and follow WCAG guidelines.

faq.question: Can I copy and paste these examples directly?
faq.answer: Yes. All code examples are production-ready. Adjust spacing, colors, and sizes as needed for your specific design requirements.
